column4: could anyone help me figure out a way to get pon dsl-provider on my bootup?
you want to run a script when you boot?
put it at the end of /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh
egad ... i know it's before the exit but all them ifs and fs got me confused could ya gimme a hand?
stick it right at the end if you like
that's not really an exit, it's a ": exit", isn't it?
sure, if that's the line you want to run
yeah yer right
I've no idea why that ": exit" is there.  : doesn't do anything
prolly just a post sign for us dummies
that werk ... great coach.
thanks
i learn that last night .... ctrl + l
can u like toggle the location bar mode?
I've no idea.  I'd like to know, but don't know how to find out.  the man page for nautilus is tiny, and the on-line help doesn't seem to be searchable
well i thought i'd ask ... thanks anyway
the only way I can find to toggle the location bar mode is using the configuration editor, as I described above.
yeap one of u good fellas showed that to me last night
which file was it again that i should add the line pon adsl-provide
I think you've got the wrong person
oh no, I remember you...  /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh
